categories.title: Tanzania Safari Excursions
categories.description: Day trips and excursions from Arusha and Moshi

safaris.title: Coffee Farm and Mangalia Waterfalls Tour
safaris.description: Enjoy the perfect blend of culture, nature, and relaxation on this two-part Tanzanian adventure. Your journey begins with a hotel pick-up, taking you to a local coffee farm for a guided coffee tour. Learn about the entire process of coffee-making, from bean to brew, and discover the rich history of Tanzanian coffee.
highlights: Learn coffee-making process from bean to brew
Views of Mount Meru and Mount Kilimanjaro

safaris.title: Arusha Walking City Tour - History, Culture & Lifestyle
safaris.description: Discover the vibrant heart of Arusha on our immersive Walking City Tour, a perfect blend of culture, history, and local life. Journey through governmental districts, museums, markets, and cultural centers.
highlights: Natural History Museum in colonial German fortress
African Art Gallery and Cultural Heritage Centre

safaris.title: Materuni Waterfalls, Coffee, and Hotsprings Tour
safaris.description: Following pickup from your accommodation, head to Materuni Village. Take a short but challenging hike to Materuni Falls with beautiful views. Visit a coffee farm to learn about growing, harvesting, and processing. Try roasting and preparing fresh local coffee.

safaris.title: Arusha National Park Full-Day Safari
safaris.description: Explore Arusha National Park, home of Mt Meru. Opportunity to see giraffes, Cape buffalos, zebras, warthogs, colobus monkeys, blue monkeys, flamingos, elephants, bushbucks, and many other animals. Leopard population present but rarely seen.

categories.title: Tanzania Top Requested Safaris
categories.description: The best 5 safari destinations in Tanzania

safaris.title: Witness the Great Migration in Serengeti
safaris.description: Experiencing the Great Migration in the Serengeti is without question one of the best Tanzania safaris, where over 1.5 million wildebeest and zebras storm across golden plains in search of greener pastures.

safaris.title: Climb Mount Kilimanjaro
safaris.description: Trekking Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa's highest peak at 5,895 meters, offers one of the most iconic challenges. With no technical gear required, climbers journey through ecological zones from rainforest to alpine desert before reaching snow-capped summit at Uhuru Peak.
highlights: Ecological zones from rainforest to alpine

safaris.title: Track Wild Chimpanzees in Mahale Mountains
safaris.description: In the remote jungles along Lake Tanganyika, chimpanzee tracking in Mahale Mountains ranks among the most soulful Tanzania safaris. With limited tourist traffic, the experience feels deeply personal.

safaris.title: Hot Air Balloon Safari
safaris.description: Gliding above the Serengeti at sunrise in a hot air balloon is one of the most magical Tanzania safaris. As the sky shifts from blush to gold, the savannah comes alive below .

safaris.title: Explore Ngorongoro Crater
safaris.description: Descending into the Ngorongoro Crater, a vast ancient volcanic caldera, is like entering a lost world. This 600-meter-deep basin shelters incredible variety of wildlife.
highlights: Thousands of flamingos on crater lake

safaris.title: Visit Zanzibar Island
safaris.description: Embark on an unforgettable journey through Zanzibar, the ultimate tropical paradise known for pristine beaches, vibrant culture, and historic charm. Explore Stone Town's rich heritage, relax on Nungwi's golden sands, or snorkel in turquoise waters of Mnemba Island.

seasonInfo.drySeason: June to October and December to February
seasonInfo.bestTime: Dry seasons for beach activities and sightseeing
seasonInfo.festivals: Zanzibar International Film Festival in July

safaris.title: Lake Manyara - Serengeti - Ngorongoro Crater
safaris.description: A 6-day budget safari covering Lake Manyara, Serengeti and Ngorongoro Crater, offering incredible wildlife viewing opportunities.

days.title: Lake Manyara
days.description: Head west towards Lake Manyara Park. After a game drive proceed to the Lake Manyara Hotel overlooking the Great Rift Valley and shimmering lake (130 kms, 2 1/2 hrs.)

days.title: Serengeti
days.description: After morning game drive, proceed to Serengeti Park noticing the change in terrain from highland forest to open plain. View game enroute to the lodge for overnight (205 kms, 4 hrs).

days.title: Serengeti
days.description: Spend the day in the heart of Tanzania's big game viewing country.

days.title: Ngorongoro
days.description: After morning game drive, continue to Olduvai Gorge to see the famous archeological site. Proceed towards Ngorongoro, where you will spend the night at a lodge overlooking the crater (250 kms, 6 hrs.)

days.title: Ngorongoro
days.description: Spend a full day in the legendary crater viewing an astonishing array of wildlife.

days.title: Return to Arusha
days.description: Depart for Arusha arriving before lunch (190 kms, 4 hrs).

safaris.title: Tarangire - Lake Manyara - Serengeti - Ngorongoro Crater
safaris.description: A comprehensive 7-day budget safari covering Tarangire, Lake Manyara, Serengeti and Ngorongoro Crater.

days.title: Tarangire
days.description: Morning drive to Tarangire National Park, situated in a vast valley offering beautiful views over savannah grassland. After lunch and a game drive, retire to the lodge for the night (120 kms, 2 hrs).

days.title: Lake Manyara
days.description: Continue to Lake Manyara Park for lunch game drive and overnight (205 kms, 4 1/2 hrs).

days.title: Serengeti
days.description: After breakfast proceed to Gibb's farm for lunch. Continue to Serengeti National Park for the night.

days.title: Serengeti
days.description: Full day game viewing in the Serengeti encompassing the largest migratory concentration of plains game in the world.

days.title: Ngorongoro
days.description: After a morning game drive and breakfast, continue to Olduvai Gorge. Proceed to Ngorongoro for the night (250 kms, 6 hrs).

days.title: Ngorongoro
days.description: Descend 2000 Ft to the crater floor, for a full day of game viewing amongst the panoply of wildlife.

days.title: Return to Arusha
days.description: After breakfast return to Arusha, arriving before lunch (190 Kms, 4Hrs).

notes: Tanzania road safaris also originate from Nairobi or Mombasa
Border formalities at Namanga or Taveta respectively
Regular flights available from Nairobi and Mombasa to Tanzania

safaris.title: Ngorongoro - Lake Manyara - Arusha
safaris.description: A 4-day luxury safari featuring Ngorongoro Crater and Lake Manyara with stays at premium lodges.

days.title: Ngorongoro Crater
days.description: Morning departures from Nairobi for Tanzania, crossing the border at Namanga and arriving in Arusha in time for lunch. Continue to the Ngorongoro crater arriving at the Wildlife Lodge, built on the crater rim. Dinner and overnight at Ngorongoro Wildlife Lodge.

days.title: Ngorongoro
days.description: Breakfast at the lodge and descend into the crater floor by special 4-wheel drive vehicle for a full day of game viewing. The magnificent black-maned Lion, elephant, buffalo, and rhino all exist in greater concentration here than anywhere else in Africa. Dinner and overnight at Ngorongoro Wildlife Lodge.

days.title: Lake Manyara
days.description: Breakfast at Ngorongoro and depart for Lake Manyara Hotel overlooking the Rift valley and the lake. Lunch at the hotel and afternoon game drive in the park around the lake where a great variety of game and birds live including the famous tree climbing lions.

days.title: Return to Arusha
days.description: After breakfast proceed to Arusha for Lunch.

safaris.title: Lake Manyara - Serengeti - Ngorongoro Crater
safaris.description: A 6-day luxury safari covering the highlights of Tanzania's northern circuit with premium accommodations.

days.title: Lake Manyara
days.description: Head west towards Lake Manyara Park. After a game drive proceed to the Lake Manyara Hotel overlooking the great Rift Valley and the shimmering lake.

days.title: Serengeti
days.description: After morning game drive, proceed to the Serengeti Park noticing the change in Terrain from highland forest to open plain. View game enroute to the lodge for overnight.

days.title: Serengeti
days.description: Spend the day in the heart of Tanzania's big game viewing country.

days.title: Ngorongoro
days.description: After morning game drive, continue to Olduvai Gorge to see the famous archeological site. Proceed towards Ngorongoro, where you will spend the night at a lodge overlooking the crater.

days.title: Ngorongoro
days.description: Spend a full day in the legendary crater viewing an astonishing array of wildlife.

days.title: Return to Arusha
days.description: Depart for Arusha arriving before lunch.

safaris.title: Tarangire - Lake Manyara - Serengeti - Ngorongoro Crater
safaris.description: A comprehensive 7-day luxury safari covering all major northern Tanzania parks with premium lodges.

days.title: Tarangire
days.description: Morning drive to Tarangire National Park, situated in a vast valley offering beautiful views over savannah grassland. After lunch and a game drive, retire to the lodge for the night.

days.title: Lake Manyara
days.description: Continue to Lake Manyara Park for lunch game drive and overnight.

days.title: Serengeti
days.description: After breakfast, proceed to Gibb's farm for lunch. Continue to Serengeti National Park for the night.

days.title: Serengeti
days.description: Full day game viewing in the Serengeti encompassing the largest migratory concentration of plains game in the world.

days.title: Ngorongoro
days.description: After a morning game drive and breakfast, continue to Olduvai Gorge. Proceed to Ngorongoro for the night.

days.title: Return to Arusha

categories.title: Tanzania Birding Destinations
categories.description: Top birding locations in Tanzania with over 1,000 recorded bird species
categories.intro: Top birding destinations in Tanzania include the Serengeti, Ngorongoro Crater, Lake Manyara, Tarangire, Ruaha, Selous (Nyerere National Park), the Usambara and Udzungwa Mountains, and areas around Lake Victoria. The best time for birdwatching is generally between November and April, though the dry season is better for combining birding with big game viewing.

safaris.title: Tanzania Birding Destinations
safaris.description: Tanzania offers exceptional birding opportunities with over 1,000 recorded bird species across diverse habitats from coastal forests to mountain highlands.

birdingLocations.name: Mount Kilimanjaro
birdingLocations.description: Forested between 1,500m and 3,000m with National Park lying above 2,700m. Home to alpine and woodland species including Hill Chat, Scarlet-tufted Malachite Sunbird, Abbott's Starling and Lammergeier.

birdingLocations.name: Ruaha National Park
birdingLocations.description: One of the driest protected areas in Tanzania with over 400 species. Holds important populations of two Tanzanian endemics: Ashy Starling and Yellow-collared Lovebird.

birdingLocations.name: Serengeti National Park
birdingLocations.description: One of the best-known parks in Africa, between Lake Victoria and Eastern Rift Valley, adjacent to Kenya's Masai Mara. Holds three Tanzanian endemics: Grey-breasted Spurfowl, Fischer's Lovebird, and Rufous-tailed Weaver. Many large flocks of African and Palearctic migrants during peak periods.

birdingLocations.name: Selous Game Reserve (Nyerere National Park)
birdingLocations.description: In south-east Tanzania, one of the largest protected areas in Africa at 50,000 km2. Numerous miombo endemics occur here. Rufigi River excellent for water birds such as African Skimmer.

birdingLocations.name: Ngorongoro Conservation Area
birdingLocations.description: Part of crater highlands, altitude from 1,700m at crater floor to 3,000m at rim. Over 500 species including largest known population of Fischer's Lovebird. Important wetlands for Greater and Lesser Flamingo. Black Rhinoceros cradled in scenic caldera.

birdingLocations.name: Dar es Salaam Coast
birdingLocations.description: Includes tidal mudflats, river inlets, saltpans, mangroves, thickets, and offshore islands creating diverse habitat with over 450 species. Major importance for migratory waders including Grey Plover, Little Stint, and Curlew Sandpiper.

birdingLocations.name: Lake Victoria
birdingLocations.description: Has four Important Birding Areas important for cormorants, egrets, and herons. Rubondo Island National Park holds Sitatunga and Spotted-necked Otters.

birdingLocations.name: Lake Natron
birdingLocations.description: Shallow soda lake on Eastern Rift valley floor, extends 58 km south of Kenyan border. Most important breeding site for majority of world population of Lesser Flamingo. Arid surrounding habitat offers Buff-crested Bustard, Spike-heeled Lark. Excellent for mammals: Gerenuk, Steenbok, occasionally Lesser Kudu.

birdingLocations.name: Mkomazi Game Reserve
birdingLocations.description: Holds species at southern limit of range, extending to southern base of South Pare Mountains. Includes Friedmann's Lark, Pygmy Batis, Three-streaked Tchagra, Shelley's Starling, and Pringle's Puffback.

birdingLocations.name: Kitulo Plateau National Park
birdingLocations.description: One of the best places to see Denham's Bustard and Blue Swallow as well as amazing ground orchids.

birdingLocations.name: Zanzibar
birdingLocations.description: Has two Important Birding Areas important for waders and terns including non-breeding populations of Crab-plover. Jozani Forest Reserve contains only remaining forest with endemic races of Fischer's Turaco, Little Greenbul, and Grey Sunbird. East Coast Akalat can be found along with Zanzibar Red Colobus, Ader's Duiker and Pemba Flying Fox.

birdingLocations.name: Kilombero Floodplain
birdingLocations.description: 260 km long and up to 52 km wide, one of the largest wetlands in Africa. Confluence of rivers and seasonally-flooded marshes home to rich birdlife including endemic species: Kilombero weaver, Kilombero cisticola, Melodius cisticola, Iringa akalat, and Dappled throated mountain robin.

birdingLocations.name: Lindi District Coastal Forests
birdingLocations.description: Important for coastal forest birds such as Southern Banded Snake Eagle, East Coast Akalat, Spotted Ground-Thrush, and specialities like Livingstone's Flycatcher.

birdingLocations.name: Pemba Island
birdingLocations.description: Lies 55 km off mainland, holds 4 endemic species: Pemba Green Pigeon, Pemba Scops Owl, Pemba Sunbird, and Pemba White-eye.

birdingLocations.name: East Usambara Mountains
birdingLocations.description: One of most important areas on African mainland for conservation of globally threatened species. Includes Usambara Eagle Owl, Sokoke Scops Owl, Long-billed Tailorbird, Dappled Mountain-Robin, Swynnerton's Robin and Usambara Weaver. West Usambara important for Usambara Akalat, Banded Sunbird, Sharpe's Starling. Best locations: Mazumbai and Magamba.

birdingLocations.name: Uluguru Mountains
birdingLocations.description: Halfway between Udzungwa and Dar. Only locality for Uluguru Bush-Shrike and Loveridge's Sunbird plus 5 endemic subspecies. May see Abbott's Duiker, one of rarest African antelopes.

birdingLocations.name: Udzungwa Mountains
birdingLocations.description: South-west of Dar es Salaam. Forest reserves hold Udzungwa Partridge, Dappled Mountain-Robin, Sharpe's Akalat, Olive-flanked Robin-Chat, and White-chested Alethe. Best accessed via spectacular Sanje waterfalls from Udzungwa National Park HQ at Mangula.

safaris.bestTime: November to April for birdwatching, dry season better for combining with big game viewing

safaris.title: Kenya / Tanzania Safari
safaris.description: An 11-day safari covering the best of Kenya and Tanzania, including tree hotels, Samburu, Lake Nakuru, Lake Manyara, Serengeti and Ngorongoro Crater.

days.title: Tree Hotel
days.description: Morning drive to the forested highlands of the Aberdares. After lunch at the base hotel, transfer to your tree hotel for game watching at the floodlit water hole.

days.title: Samburu
days.description: Continue north across the equator to the home of the Samburu people. Marvel at the rugged scenery of isolated crags and springs in this semi arid region. After a game drive, relax in the comfort of your lodge.

days.title: Samburu Game Viewing
days.description: Morning and later afternoon, game drives along the Uaso Nyiro river. In addition to the carnivores, view the rare species of herbivores such as the Beisa oryx or the Grevy zebra.

days.title: Lake Nakuru
days.description: The drive to Lake Nakuru provides stunning vistas between the escarpments of the Rift Valley. During the game drive, behold the amazing sight of candy pink flamingoes lining the waters of the alkaline lake.

days.title: Nairobi
days.description: After breakfast, depart for Nairobi, arriving before lunch. Afternoon at your leisure.

days.title: Lake Manyara
days.description: Cross the border to Tanzania at Namanga, stopping at Arusha for Lunch. Proceed to Lake Manyara for a game drive. Spend the night at the Lake Manyara Hotel.

days.title: Serengeti
days.description: Morning game drive reveals the famous tree climbing lions which spend most of the day along branches of acacia trees. After lunch, proceed to Serengeti Park for the night.

days.title: Serengeti Game Viewing
days.description: Experience an exciting spectacle of the astounding concentrations of game and extensive bird life at home on the Serengeti plains.

days.title: Ngorongoro
days.description: After a morning game drive in the Serengeti, continue to the 'cradle of Mankind' at Olduvai Gorge. Proceed to Ngorongoro for the night.

days.title: Ngorongoro Crater
days.description: During the day's game drives, discover this legendary crater containing the greatest permanent concentration of wildlife in Africa.

days.title: Return to Nairobi
days.description: Stopping at Arusha for Lunch, return to Nairobi via Namanga.
